Field.FormMenuDescription: Early Childhood Behavior Questionnaire Short Form (ECBQ-SF)

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: INSTRUCTIONS: Please read carefully before starting. As you read each description of the child's behavior below, please indicate how often the child did this during the last two weeks by choosing one of the numbers. These numbers indicate how often you observed the behavior described during the last two weeks. 1 - never 2 - very rarely 3 - less than half the time 4 - about half the time 5 - more than half the time 6 - almost always 7 - always NA - does not apply The "Does Not Apply" column (NA) is used when you did not see the child in the situation described during the last two weeks. For example, if the situation mentions the child going to the doctor and there was no time during the last two weeks when the child went to the doctor, choose the (NA) response. "Does Not Apply" (NA) is different from "NEVER" (1). "Never" is used when you saw the child in the situation but the child never engaged in the behavior mentioned in the last two weeks. Please be sure to choose a number or NA for every item.
Field.ElementLabel:
When told that it was time for bed or a nap, how often did your child

1. get irritable?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When approached by an unfamiliar person in a public place (for example, the grocery store), how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 2. pull back and avoid the person?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>During everyday activities, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 4. tap or drum with fingers on tables or other objects?
5. become uncomfortable when his/her socks were not aligned properly on his/her feet?
6. become distressed when his/her hands were dirty and/or sticky?
7. notice low-pitched noises such as the air-conditioner, heater, or refrigerator running or starting up?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While playing outdoors, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 9. enjoy sitting quietly in the sunshine?
10. look immediately when you pointed at something?
11. choose to take chances for the fun and excitement of it?
12. seem to be one of the most active children?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When s/he was carried, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 13. push against you until put down?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While having trouble completing a task (e.g., building, drawing, dressing), how often did your child</u>
<u>When a familiar child came to your home, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 16. seek out the company of the child?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When offered a choice of activities, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 18. decide what to do very quickly and go after it?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When asked NOT to, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 19. touch an attractive item (such as an ornament) anyway?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>During daily or evening quiet time with you and your child, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 20. enjoy just being quietly sung to?
21. smile at the sound of words, as in nursery rhymes?
23. enjoy rhythmic activities, such as rocking or swaying?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While at home, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 25. show fear at a loud sound (blender, vacuum cleaner, etc.)?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While bathing, how often did your child</u>
<u>When s/he was upset, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 28. change to feeling better within a few minutes?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When engaged in play with his/her favorite toy, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 30. continue to play <U>while at the same time</U> responding to your remarks or questions?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When approaching unfamiliar children playing, how often did your child</u>
<u>During everyday activities, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 33. move quickly from one place to another?
34. notice the smoothness or roughness of objects s/he touched?
35. become sad or blue for no apparent reason?
36. pay attention to you right away when you called to him/her?
37. seem to be disturbed by loud sounds?
38. seem frightened for no apparent reason?
39. seem to be irritated by tags in his/her clothes?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>After having been interrupted, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 41. have difficulty returning to the previous activity?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When told that loved adults would visit, how often did your child</u>
<u>During quiet activities, such as reading a story, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 45. fiddle with his/her hair, clothing, etc.?
46. show repeated movements like squinting, hunching up the shoulders, or twitching the facial muscles?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While playing indoors, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 49. enjoy vigorously jumping on the couch or bed?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>In situations where s/he is meeting new people, how often did your child</u>
<u>When being gently rocked or hugged, how often did your child</u>
<u>When encountering a new activity, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 52. sit on the sidelines and observe before joining in?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When visiting the home of a familiar child, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 54. engage in an activity with the child?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When engaged in an activity requiring attention, such as building with blocks, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 56. tire of the activity relatively quickly?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While in a public place, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 57. seem uneasy about approaching an elevator or escalator?
58. cry or show distress when approached by an unfamiliar animal?
59. seem afraid of large, noisy vehicles?
60. show fear when the caregiver stepped out of sight?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When being dressed or undressed, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 61. squirm and try to get away?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When told "no", how often did your child</u>
<u>Following an exciting activity or event, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 66. have a hard time settling down?
67. seem to feel down or blue?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>During everyday activities, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 68. easily shift attention from one activity to another?
69. become bothered by sounds while in noisy environments?
70. become bothered by scratchy materials like wool?
71. notice changes in your appearance (such as wet hair, a hat, or jewelry)?
72. appear to listen to even very quiet sounds?
73. seem full of energy, even in the evening?
74. become irritated when his/her clothes were tight?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While playing indoors, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 77. enjoy activities such as being spun, etc.?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When playing alone, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 79. play with a set of objects for 5 minutes or longer at a time?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>Before an exciting event (such as receiving a new toy), how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 81. get very excited about getting it?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When s/he asked for something and you said 'no', how often did your child</u>
<u>While playing or walking outdoors, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 87. notice sights or sounds (for example, wind chimes or water sprinklers)?

<u>While being held on your lap, how often did your child</u>
<u>When hearing about a future family outing (such as a trip to the playground), how often did your child</u>
<u>While looking at picture books on his/her own, how often did your child</u>
<u>When a familiar adult, such as a relative or friend, visited your home, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 96. want to interact with the adult?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When asked to do so, how often was your child able to</u>
<u>When visiting a new place, how often did your child</u>
<u>While you were talking with someone else, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 100. easily switch attention from speaker to speaker?

<u>When s/he was upset, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 102. cry for more than 3 minutes, even when being comforted?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>When you were busy, how often did your child</u>
Field.ElementLabel: 104. find another activity to do when asked?

Field.ElementPreceedingHeader: <u>While playing outdoors, how often did your child</u>

Field.ElementLabel: 106. enjoy playing with a number of different people?
